reviews.review_msg: He really needs to work on his lecturing skills, especially when it's an 8:30am class. I have to strain to try and understand what he's trying to say especially when his lecture slides aren't explaining things. Half the time I end up not getting a clear answer even when he's supposed to give one. Tough marking on midterms and exams.

He seems to make class fun and interesting. No need for textbook at all. His tests are all open book but kind of hard if you're not used to open book exams. Marks papers pretty hard. You really really need to be good at writing proposals and summaries or you're screwed. Exams were marked fairly though.

He really wants students to excel. Always available and readily makes adjustments to accomodate students. Sometimes his feedback is a little confusing when talking to him. 
 Pay careful attention to marking scheme/where points come from, esp. for the presentation. 
 One of my fav profs and a fair-generous marker. 
 No need for textbook.
Very unclear. A difficult course, as it is both math and writing intensive! Be warned!
